title: Undergraduate Research in Science I
description: This is an elementary research-based course that introduces current issues and/or special important foundation topics in a science discipline. Students are required to finish one of the following two tasks:1. Read and discuss readings assigned by the instructor;2. Conduct elementary tasks on a project/study/laboratory.
outcome: 1. Fundamentals of research skills in a scientific research area in a broad sense. 2. Establish the habit of reading research materials. 3. Get familiar with the laboratory / research / project team environment.

title: Seminar I
description: This course is one of the three seminar courses included in STARS. This course aims to widen students’ scope of horizon in a broad area of scientific research. Students are required to participate in research seminars or conferences.
outcome: 1. Understand recent advances and interesting topics in science. 2. A taste of good scientific research. 3. Effective summary of scientific research outcomes.

title: Undergraduate Research in Science II
description: This is an intermediate research-based course aiming at introducing more focused research areas in a specific science discipline. Students are required to finish one of the following two tasks:1. Read and discuss recent research outputs assigned by the instructor;2. Conduct research related project/study/laboratory.
outcome: 1. Develop essential research skills in a focused scientific research area. 2. Establish the habit of reading research materials. 3. Comment on the quality and/or possible future works of related scientific research environment.

title: Seminar II
description: This course is one of the three seminar courses included in STARS. This course aims to widen students’ scope of horizon in a broad area of scientific research. Students are required to participate in research seminars or conferences.
outcome: 1. Understand recent advances and interesting topics in science. 2. A taste of good scientific research. 3. Effective summary of scientific research outcomes.

title: Undergraduate Research in Science III
description: This is an advanced research-based course. Students are required to investigate and/or analyze in depth recent advances of a specific area in the science discipline. They are expected to conduct research that may lead to future postgraduate studies.
outcome: 1. Develop solid research skills in a scientific research field. 2. Master basic research concept or methodology related to a research topic. 3. Demonstrate the understanding of a specific research direction. 4. Write a scientific report.

title: Seminar III
description: This course is one of the three seminar courses included in STARS. This course aims to widen students’ scope of horizon in a broad area of scientific research. Students are required to participate in research seminars, conferences or scientific competition.
outcome: 1. Understand recent advances and interesting topics in science. 2. A taste of good scientific research. 3. Effective communication and presentation of scientific research idea and concepts. 4. Effective summary of scientific research outcomes.
